definition: to become caught up in an irresolvable situation (idiom)

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection

sentences.english: They are locked together in a fierce quarrel over a trivial matter.
sentences.chinese: 他们为了一点小事而吵得难分难解。

sentences.english: The two animals were locked in a fight.
sentences.chinese: 这两头野兽打得难分难解。

sentences.english: He and the son of Aurora inextricably linked to a fight.
sentences.chinese: 他和欧若拉的儿子进行了一场难分难解的鏖战。
那是一场难分难解的比赛。

definition: hard to untie, hard to separate (idiom); inextricably involved/locked in battle
lit. two armies have equivalent banners and drums (idiom); fig. evenly matched/roughly comparable (opponents)
at a stalemate/deadlocked/in unrelenting mutual opposition
unable to determine victory or defeat (idiom); evenly matched/to come out even/to tie/to draw
to draw (a competition)/to fight to a standstill
locked in a stalemate/to confront one another
to both share the limelight/to both have an equal share of
chaotic warfare/confused fighting/melee/to join in such fighting
neither giving way to the other
